column1: #Text=Scottish Justice Secretary ' acutely aware of unusual publicity ' in Kular case
#Text=has obtained a letter by Scottish Justice Secretary Kenny MacAskill to former Conservative justice spokesman
#Text=in response to questions raised by our correspondent about the Mikaeel Kular murder case .

#Text=has investigated possible contempt by media publishing potentially prejudicial material , and MacAskill wrote he has " been following the case of Mikaeel Kular and [ is ] acutely aware of the unusual publicity this case has attracted .

#Text= He also wrote of the difficulties with trying to individually cover all eventualities with prescriptive legislation , saying " A trial for a sexual offence will raise very different issues — particularly of protecting victims — from those that are raised by a tax fraud trial .

_	_	_	_

#Text=MacAskill says it is the Scottish Government 's position that the task of  counterbalancing the public interest in reporting with upholding the criminal law should be left to those whose job it is to do so — the courts and the judiciary , acting in the individual circumstances of the case " .
